pr_title: Issue 18153 when elasticsearch is not available page in cache not work

timeline.message: #18153 creating new method to find Files byparent folder from data base

timeline.bodyText: I think you should implement a new method signature for this constructor and keep the old one. Internally the old constructor could call this new implementation
timeline.author: nollymar

replies.bodyText: I usually agree with backward compatibility, but I think people do not call the constructors, people use APILocator to delegate the construction, so I would say it is ok
replies.author: jdotcms

timeline.bodyText: Cool, I would put this in another more reusable place
timeline.author: jdotcms

timeline.bodyText: doc
timeline.author: jdotcms

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/dotCMS/src/main/java/com/dotmarketing/portlets/fileassets/business/FileAssetFactory.java b/dotCMS/src/main/java/com/dotmarketing/portlets/fileassets/business/FileAssetFactory.java
index bf0dbbb11b..ca8c3d2a6a 100644
--- a/dotCMS/src/main/java/com/dotmarketing/portlets/fileassets/business/FileAssetFactory.java
+++ b/dotCMS/src/main/java/com/dotmarketing/portlets/fileassets/business/FileAssetFactory.java

@@ -8,6 +8,20 @@ import com.liferay.portal.model.User;
 
 import java.util.List;
 
+/**
+ * This class provides methods to access information about directly from data base
+ */
 public interface FileAssetFactory {
+
+    /**
+     * Return the FileAsset into a {@link Folder}, it just return the FileAsset for which the user has permission.
+     *
+     * @param parentFolder Folder to search the files
+     * @param user User to check permission
+     * @param respectFrontendRoles it is true the Frontend roles are respect
+     * @return
+     * @throws DotDataException
+     * @throws DotSecurityException
+     */
     List<Contentlet>  findFileAssetsByFolderInDB(Folder parentFolder, User user, boolean respectFrontendRoles) throws DotDataException, DotSecurityException;
 }

timeline.bodyText: this should be the first line, well before the dotConnect
timeline.author: jdotcms

timeline.bodyText: Immutable?
timeline.author: jdotcms

timeline.bodyText:
this could be better to handle by ExceptionUtil.causedBy
The immediate cause could be a wrapper of the real one, should go in deep
timeline.author: jdotcms

replies.bodyText:
If you log, then we should use the Logger.warnEveryAndDebug(final Class cl, final String message, final Throwable ex, final int warnEveryMillis) 
and write every 5000ms
replies.author: wezell

timeline.bodyText: add a sync block here
timeline.author: wezell

timeline.bodyText: I would rename this method. Even when there are comments that explain the test, the name itself doesn't say something really helpful as the annotation @Test(expected = DotSecurityException.class)  says exactly that
timeline.author: nollymar
